5.m: But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God, who were born, not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man, but of God. - John 1:12-13

l.q: What does verse 1 say about the Word?
l.a: The Word was in the beginning with God. The Word was God. All things were made through him.

l.q: What happened to the Word in verse 14? Who is the Word in verse 17?
l.a: The Word became flesh and lived with us. Jesus Christ is the Word.

l.q: What is the promise in verses 12 & 13?
l.a: To all who received Jesus Christ and believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.
